alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 24 at 2:13AM MDT until April 26 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Periods of Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. * WHERE...South Laramie Range, including the Interstate 80 Summit. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Areas of dense fog with visibilities near zero possible Tuesday, especially between mile markers 320 and 330.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
